item.title: Katie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Everyone looks retarded once you set your mind to it." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Katie add a quote by Haven Kimmel
item.description: "On Jesus: "Everyone around me was flat-out in love with him, and who wouldn't be? He was good with animals, he loved his mother, and he wasn't afraid of blind people." -- Haven Kimmel

item.title: Katie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Katie add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Katie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Boy, those French! They have a different word for everything." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Katie add a quote by Haven Kimmel
item.description: "I later discovered that in order to be a good athlete one must care intensely what is happening with a ball, even if one doesn't have possession of it. This was ultimately my failure: my inability to work up a passion for the location of balls." -- Haven Kimmel

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Katie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Katie add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Katie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "When you're in jail, a good friend will be trying to bail you out. A best friend will be in the cell next to you saying, 'Damn, that was fun'." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Katie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Katie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Just the other day, I was in my neighborhood Starbucks, waiting for the post office to open. I was enjoying a chocolatey cafe mocha when it occurred to me that to drink a mocha is to gulp down the entire history of the New World. From the Spanish exportation of Aztec cacao, and the Dutch invention of the chemical process for making cocoa, on down to the capitalist empire of Hershey, PA, and the lifestyle marketing of Seattle's Starbucks, the modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Like Lincoln, I would like to believe the ballot is stronger than the bullet. Then again, he said that before he got shot." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "In these fast and fickle times, it’s nice to know that there are some things you can always count on: the enduring brilliance of the last page of The Great Gatsby; the near-religious harmonies of the Beach Boys’ “California Girls”; and the lifelong friendship of Matt Damon and Ben Affleck." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "American history is a quagmire, and the more one knows, the quaggier the mire gets." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Behind every bad law, a deep fear." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "When one of a culture's guiding credos is that "all men are created equal," any person who, say, becomes an expert on, say, nuclear weapons or, say, ecology, i.e., anyone who distinguishes himself through mental excellence, is a nuisance." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Katie add a quote by Paul Hawken
item.description: "The bottom line is down where it belongs – at the bottom. Far above it in importance are the infinite number of events that produce the profit or loss. " -- Paul Hawken

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Everything you're sure is right can be wrong in another place. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "God doesn’t need to punish us. He just grants us a long enough life to punish ourselves." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The changes we dread most may contain our salvation." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "When we traded homemaking for careers, we were implicitly promised economic independence and worldly influence. But a devil of a bargain it has turned out to be in terms of daily life. We gave up the aroma of warm bread rising, the measured pace of nurturing routines, the creative task of molding our families' tastes and zest for life; we received in exchange the minivan and the Lunchable." -- Barbara Kingsolver
